main event: A radar contact was tracked for 10 minutes on September 2, 1961, over Bellevue, Ohio, suggesting an unidentified flying object.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar at a speed of up to 600 mph., It was approximately 60 feet in diameter and irregular in shape., Initial thoughts proposed it could be a meteor or aircraft., The source of the information was an unidentified civilian associated with a school in Bucyrus, Ohio., Multiple sightings reported in the area on preceding nights.
sighted object: irregular-shaped object approximately 60 feet in diameter
witness description: A civilian associated with the school system in Bucyrus, Ohio
